filmography.title: It's a Wonderful Life
filmography.role_description: The flirtatious town girl with a heart of gold who has a crush on George Bailey; one of her most enduring roles.
filmography.plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

filmography.title: Crossfire
filmography.role_description: A weary dance-hall hostess who provides a key alibi in a murder investigation; the role earned her first Oscar nomination.
filmography.plot: A man is murdered, apparently by one of a group of soldiers just out of the army. Police investigate the motive, which may be anti-Semitism.

filmography.title: Song of the Thin Man
filmography.role_description: A jazz singer who helps Nick and Nora Charles navigate the underground music scene to solve a murder.
filmography.plot: Nick and Nora investigate the murder of a bandleader on a gambling ship, leading them into the jazz world.

filmography.title: Merton of the Movies
filmography.role_description: A movie star who becomes the object of a bumbling fan's adoration in this Red Skelton comedy.
filmography.plot: A movie-struck theater usher goes to Hollywood to become a star, but gets cast in comedies instead of the dramas he prefers.

filmography.title: A Woman's Secret
filmography.role_description: A radio singer who is shot, leading to her mentor confessing to the crime to protect her.
filmography.plot: A singer is shot and her mentor confesses to the crime, but flashbacks reveal a complex relationship of jealousy and ambition.

filmography.title: Roughshod
filmography.role_description: A saloon girl who joins a rancher on a dangerous trek to California, pursued by escaped convicts.
filmography.plot: A rancher driving horses to California is followed by three vengeful escaped convicts and joined by four dance hall girls.

filmography.title: In a Lonely Place
filmography.role_description: A cool, enigmatic neighbor who provides an alibi for a volatile screenwriter (Humphrey Bogart) but begins to fear his temper.
filmography.plot: A potentially violent screenwriter is a murder suspect until his lovely neighbor clears him. However, she soon starts to have her doubts.

filmography.title: The Greatest Show on Earth
filmography.role_description: A circus elephant performer who has a rivalry with a fellow performer in Cecil B. DeMille's massive epic.
filmography.plot: The dramatic lives of trapeze artists, a clown, and an elephant trainer are told against a background of circus spectacle.

filmography.title: Macao
filmography.role_description: A spunky, dice-throwing nightclub singer stranded in Macao who gets mixed up with Robert Mitchum and a crime boss.
filmography.plot: Three strangers arrive in the port of Macao, including a singer, a drifter, and a detective, all with secrets.

filmography.title: Sudden Fear
filmography.role_description: The scheming, younger mistress of Jack Palance who plots with him to murder his wealthy wife (Joan Crawford).
filmography.plot: A wealthy playwright discovers that her new husband and his mistress are plotting to murder her.

filmography.title: The Bad and the Beautiful
filmography.role_description: The flirtatious Southern wife of a novelist, whose tragic distraction leads to a pivotal moment in the film; earned her the Oscar.
filmography.plot: An unscrupulous movie producer alienates a director, an actress, and a writer while making them stars.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: The Glass Wall
filmography.role_description: A desperate factory worker who tries to help a stowaway refugee evade the police in New York City.
filmography.plot: A refugee stowaway jumps ship in New York to find the man who can prove his identity, pursued by the police.

filmography.title: Man on a Tightrope
filmography.role_description: The unfaithful young wife of a circus manager who plans a daring escape from behind the Iron Curtain.
filmography.plot: A circus troupe in Communist Czechoslovakia plots to escape across the border to freedom in West Germany.

filmography.title: The Big Heat
filmography.role_description: A gangster's moll who befriends a rogue cop and suffers a horrific disfigurement in one of noir's most famous scenes.
filmography.plot: A tough cop takes on a corrupt political syndicate after they kill his wife in a car bomb meant for him.

filmography.title: Prisoners of the Casbah
filmography.role_description: A princess who must hide her identity and escape a harem with the help of the Captain of the Guards.
filmography.plot: The Captain of the Guards in 18th-century Algiers tries to save the princess from a corrupt Grand Vizier.

filmography.title: The Good Die Young
filmography.role_description: The neglected wife of a boxer who gets drawn into a robbery scheme orchestrated by a sociopathic aristocrat.
filmography.plot: Four men with nothing in common but desperation team up to rob a mail van near London's Heathrow Airport.

filmography.title: Human Desire
filmography.role_description: A seductive, manipulative wife who traps a returning Korean War veteran in a plot to murder her husband.
filmography.plot: A train engineer becomes involved in a love triangle and a murder plot with a co-worker's sultry wife.

filmography.title: Naked Alibi
filmography.role_description: A nightclub singer caught between a relentless police chief and the cop-killer he is pursuing.
filmography.plot: A police chief pursues a suspect he believes is a cop killer into Mexico, where he meets a singer with ties to the suspect.

filmography.title: The Cobweb
filmography.role_description: The frustrated wife of a clinic director who battles with the staff over the selection of new drapes for the library.
filmography.plot: Staff and patients at a psychiatric clinic clash over drapes for the library, revealing deep personal dysfunctions.

filmography.title: Not as a Stranger
filmography.role_description: A wealthy seductress who tempts an ambitious, married doctor, played by Robert Mitchum.
filmography.plot: A medical student marries an older woman to pay his tuition, but his arrogance alienates those around him.

filmography.title: Oklahoma!
filmography.role_description: The flirtatious farm girl who 'cain't say no' to any man, providing comic relief in this classic musical.
filmography.plot: In the Oklahoma territory, a farm girl is courted by a cowboy and a menacing farmhand, while her friend Annie has her own romantic troubles.

filmography.title: The Man Who Never Was
filmography.role_description: A woman whose grief is exploited by British intelligence to create a backstory for a fake corpse used to deceive the Nazis.
filmography.plot: British intelligence uses a corpse with false papers to trick the Axis powers into believing the Allies will invade Greece instead of Sicily.

filmography.title: Ride Out for Revenge
filmography.role_description: A woman in the Old West who becomes involved with a marshal sympathetic to the Native American cause.
filmography.plot: A marshal tries to protect the Cheyenne Indians from being cheated out of their land and food by corrupt officials.

filmography.title: Odds Against Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: The lonely neighbor of a desperate bank robber (Robert Ryan) who offers him comfort before his final job.
filmography.plot: A desperate ex-cop, an indebted nightclub singer, and a racist ex-con team up to rob a bank.

filmography.title: Melvin and Howard
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as the mother of Melvin Dummar in this acclaimed comedy-drama about a man who claims to be Howard Hughes' heir.
filmography.plot: A down-on-his-luck milkman claims to have given a ride to Howard Hughes, who leaves him 156 million dollars in his will.
